metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3178 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** fs/nfsd/nfs3xdr.c in the Linux kernel through 5.10.8, when there is an NFS export of a subdirectory of a filesystem, allows remote attackers to traverse to other parts of the filesystem via READDIRPLUS. NOTE: some parties argue that such a subdirectory export is not intended to prevent this attack; see also the exports(5) no_subtree_check default behavior. 吴异 discovered that the NFS implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly prevent access outside of an NFS export that is a subdirectory of a file system. An attacker could possibly use this to bypass NFS access restrictions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-204-generic - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-lowlatency - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-4.4.0-204-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-204-generic - 4.4.0-204.236
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-204-lowlatency - 4.4.0-204.236
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-204.236').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.137').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1095.102~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1109.121~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.80').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1094.107~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-137.141~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1089.98').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.74~16.04.1').

linux-signed-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1109.121~16.04.1').
